page.title: 05VILLAGE LIFE II
page.content: costumes are worn by all the participants.Traditional teas are served. Farming-In our area there are 4 farms and 1 garden centre.Pentland Mains is owned by Mr+Mrs Mckewan.It is approx 85 acres.They grow oats,barley,and turnips and have fields for grazing. 3 breeds of cattle are Kert,Hereford cross,Charolais cross and shetland. Which are unusual.In summer the cattle graze outside in winter they are kept in sheds.Mrs Mckewan keeps unusual chickens,Cochins from China and Aracauna from Spain. Langhill Farm-This farm has a dairy herd of 200 friesians,50 are kept inside as part of an experiment to see how much cows eat.They are trying to improve the milk yield.
